relation: Work Breakdown Structure
Task Name
Transformation 6: T-13 - Create a certification program to ensure employees have sufficient knowledge, skills and ability (KSAs) to support quality goals
Create a working group of managers and senior attorneys to define KSAs (T-13)
Determine method of testing to measure core competencies or KSAs related to Examiner functions/positions at the GS-11/12; GS-13/14 and GS-14/15 (T-13)
Pilot e-learning web-based system (T-13)
Evaluate pilot results (T-13)
Procure web-based e-learning/training system (T-13)
Identify KSA criteria for designing test modules for GS-13/14 and GS-14/15 (T-13)
Develop web-based KSA training and testing module for examiners/managers (T-13)
Share proposal with TPAC and user community (T-13)
Conduct a pilot to test the proposal/evaluate the results (T-13)
Determine how the program will be administered/supported (T-13)
Address labor relations implications (T-13)
Assess changes to employee PAPs (T-13)
Conduct impact and implementation bargaining, if required, for examiner certification (T-13)
Share results of the pilot with the user community (T-13)
Communicate the purpose and requirements of the certification program (T-13)
Implement the examiner and manager certification program pending successful results of the pilot program (T-13)
Monitor examiner and manager test results; quality review findings; revise materials as appropriate (T-13)
Determine the core competencies or KSAs related to Paralegal/support staff functions/positions; identify criteria for designing test modules (T-13)
Develop web-based KSA training and testing module for paralegal/support staff (T-13)
Determine how the program will be administered/supported (T-13)
Address labor relations implications (T-13)
Assess changes to employee PAPs (T-13)
Implement paralegal/support staff certification program (T-13)
Monitor test results; quality review findings; revise materials as appropriate (T-13)
Start
Finish

pageTitle: Certification of Knowledge, Skills and Ability
title: Implementation Schedule
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {5924=Actions are under way to implement this recommendation during calendar year 2003.  Trademarks is currently testing training modules that are being prepared to test the use of a web-based training tool. }
textBeforeTable: Actions are under way to implement this recommendation during calendar year 2003.  Trademarks is currently testing training modules that are being prepared to test the use of a web-based training tool.  Actions Taken: 3.     Higher level of applicant satisfaction with examination and registration process. 2.     Reduced rework. 1.     Improved quality. Return on Investment: 2.     Ensuring that the level of testing is not so low that the quality of our work products is not acceptable to applicants and our stakeholders. 1.     Ensuring that required level of knowledge, skills and ability is consistent with quality requirements. Risks: 3.     The certification program will be administered using a web-based training and testing system. 2.     Establish criteria for periodic testing to re-certify individuals (e.g., three years). 1.     Determine current knowledge, skills and ability required for each position in the trademark process (two months). Details and Timing: Implement a re-certification program in Trademarks. USPTO Recommended Course of Action: In order to maintain the core competency and the proficiency of the trademark professionals, the Office should create a series of tests that enable individuals to demonstrate their competencies related to the examination process and their ability to work independently throughout their career at the USPTO.  Upon passing a test, the individual will be promoted.  The test content and difficulty will be based on the individuals grade and the job that the individual is performing.  For trademark examiners, at the GS-11 and GS-12 level, we would test for legal competencies.  After the
